description: # Logic bug: accumulator initialized to 1 instead of 0 -> wrong sum for typical lists
# Syntax bug via indentation error introduced in complex function - subtle in large files
# API misuse: not specifying timeout on requests.get; can hang in production
# Off-by-one: wrong slice end causes missing last item
# Concurrency bug: shared mutable state without locking causes race conditions
# Performance antipattern: building strings in a loop (quadratic cost)
# API misuse / security: naive SQL concatenation leads to SQL injection
# Off-by-one: loop uses <= causing IndexError on last iteration in some cases
/* Logic bug: forgetting to return inside callback leads to multiple responses in Express handlers */
// Syntax bug: trailing comma missing in a large object literal after refactor
/* API misuse: using fs.readFileSync on request path without validation - blocking & insecure */
// Off-by-one: incorrect calculation of slice end leads to missing one item per page
/* Concurrency bug: using var in loop causing closure to capture same i and wrong behavior */
/* Performance antipattern: synchronous crypto operation in request handler blocks event loop */
/* API misuse: incorrect Buffer.concat usage with numeric length causes silent truncation */
/* Logic bug: double insert due to missing error handling path - race in callback leads to duplicate DB writes */

// Syntax/type bug: incorrect interface property name causes type mismatch at runtime
// Logic bug: mutating input array passed from caller causes surprising side-effects
// API misuse: not checking response.ok before parsing JSON leads to thrown errors on non-2xx
// Off-by-one: loop condition uses <= causing out of bounds access
// Concurrency bug: executing heavy async tasks sequentially instead of in parallel
// Performance antipattern: nested map/filter causing quadratic complexity over large arrays
// API misuse: using 'any' to silence types leads to runtime surprises
// Logic bug: incorrect timezone handling by using getDate instead of getUTCDate in shared service
// Syntax bug: missing closing brace introduced during merge conflict resolution
// Logic bug: loose falsy check treats 0 as missing value
// API misuse / security: injecting unsanitized user input into innerHTML
// Off-by-one: substring end index off-by-one losing last char
// Concurrency bug: using Promise.race to implement timeout without cleanup leads to dangling operations
// Performance antipattern: reading layout and writing in tight loop cause layout thrashing
// API misuse: deep callback pyramid causing hard-to-handle errors and logic duplication
// Logic bug: parseInt used without radix leading to octal surprises in older engines
// Performance antipattern: parsing giant JSON on main thread instead of streaming
/* Syntax bug in JSX: missing closing tag can crash packager */
/* Logic bug: mutating state directly instead of using setState/useState setter */
/* API misuse: not handling network cancellation or component unmount - memory leaks possible */
/* Off-by-one: using <= when mapping indices causes undefined rendering item */
/* Concurrency bug: multiple rapid setState calls relying on stale state (closure over old state) */
/* Performance antipattern: creating inline functions and objects during render causing re-renders */
/* API misuse/security: storing sensitive tokens in AsyncStorage without encryption */
/* Logic bug: using index as key causing reorder bugs and UI flicker */
/* Performance antipattern: loading full-size images into memory without resize */
/* Logic/syntax mix: forgetting to await an async helper leads to unresolved promise used as data */
